parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Corinthian, of Corinth. From Korinthos; a Corinthian, i.e. Inhabitant of Corinth.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To enlarge, make broad; met: of the growth of tenderness and love. From platus; to widen.
